newsitem.title: MOROCCO: Moroccan bourse slips slightly lower.
newsitem.headline: Moroccan bourse slips slightly lower.

text.p: The Casablanca bourse closed its two-hour session on Wednesday 0.10 percent lower as most leading stocks dropped in a continued downward trend, a stockbroker said.
The all-share index closed at 431.50 compared with 431.95 points on Tuesday.

"There is a wait-and-see climate, it might be like this because people are waiting for the publication of the companies' annual results but no one can really explain what is happening," a market analyst at Casablanca-based Upline Securities said.
SNI, which has diversified stakes in more than 40 companies, closed unchanged at 535 dirhams.
SNI is Morocco's second largest private conglomerate with a market capitalisation of more than 5.5 billion dirhams.
ONA Group, the country's largest private group, shed five dirhams to 470 dirhams, a broker said.
Banque Marocaine du Commerce Exterieur, one of the liquid stocks, was unchanged at 395 dirhams.
Traded volume on the official market was 14.5 million dirhams.
